column1: {"email":"abbaconsulting777@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610982411,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"I love the part when Nathaniel 1st meets Jesus and Jesus tells him that he saw him sitting under a tree. it just reminds me that God sees us wherever we are, and that God knows us intimately and entirely. column12: {"email":"Oluwatoyinaa@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610980535,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 2:4 Jesus said to his mother “my hour has not yet come” This further reiterated the fact that God is a God of timing and so He makes all things beautiful in His time. Men may pressure but let the Holy Spirit propel you, people will convince you and truly out of love, necessity or concern giving logical reasons that  it’s time but always check with your inner witness, be sensitive, don’t look at others, you will crash if you run ahead of God, wait for your time!"}

column26: {"email":"Ope.elesin@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610977512,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"For me what stood out for me was John’s humility. column29:
{"email":"egbutachinaza@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610977121,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"We just have to love the audacity of Jesus 🙂🙌🏽.  

I’ve read John several times but today, I found it curious that Jesus used the stone jars used for the “Jewish Ritual of Purification” for the miracle of turning water to wine.  

This ritual of purification is central to Jewish tradition.  The “Law” / “Torah” (of the Old Testament), commanded cleansing with water for physical and spiritual purification.  We all know that cleanliness is both a prerequisite of holiness and an aid to physical fitness / hygiene.  

But why did Jesus use these ceremonial stone jars?

He asked them to fill the jars with “water” (John 6:7).  

Two things came to my mind here:

1.) Water refreshes dryness and water brings life.  Water was (and still is) recognized for natural cleansing.  To the Jews at that time, water coming from their ceremonial cleansing jars had to be for their cleansing ritual - which occurred on the outside.  By turning the “water” from the ceremonial cleansing jars into “wine” (which is a symbol for the Holy Spirit according to Ephesians 5:18), Jesus was trying to show them (and show us) a new way.  Jesus changes the water - which washes the outer body, into the wine of the Spirit - which cleanses and regenerates internally. Jesus uses this miracle to teach us that the work of ceremonial cleansing with water could only go so far, and at best remain superficial.  But the work of cleansing by the wine of the Holy Spirit launches us to a new way of life.  Remember, John the Baptist said he baptized with water (ceremonial / traditional cleansing) but Jesus was going to baptize with the Holy Spirit (new wine) and fire.  


2.) This work of the Holy Spirit is symbolized literally to us, as new wine coming into old earthen vessels.  

This led to a bunch of questions for me:

a.) If the new wine symbolizes the (work of) Holy Spirit, then it cannot stay closed in a vessel.  Despite how significant (ceremonial) or pretty the vessel is, the new wine is useless if it is not poured out to others.  The new wine in my life must be shared to fill a void / need in the lives of everyone I encounter.  The work of the Holy Spirit must me manifest in my life. 

b.) If there is new wine, then new wine skins are needed.  The former way of doing things must change.  What am I doing on my part to ensure that this new wine does not remain in an old vessel? What steps am I taking to transition to the new level of holiness, prayerfulness, worship, service, giving? What new approaches to my faith walk, personal life, career, relationships does God want me to embrace in 2021 and beyond?"}
column30: {"email":"pelumi.ola16@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610976992,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"I really enjoyed chapter 1. column31: {"email":"japhethbalogun@outlook.com","unix_timestamp":1610976944,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 2:7 was what stood out to me when I was reading my bible, When Jesus told the servants to fill the water jars during the wedding at Cana, Galilee he did not tell them where to fill them up to, but the servants filled them up to the brim even though they could have filled them halfway. It means that we determine how much we want God to bless us, whether it is halfway or fully to the brim."}

column33: {"email":"amina2muazu@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610976344,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Like the story of creation, we see that Jesus’ first miracle is at a wedding of a man and his wife (a celebration). Today, I learnt that His presence can turn my ordinary water into extraordinary wine! His presence doesn’t hinder our celebration, but keeps the party going and memorable.\n\n~ Aminna D."}

column40:
{"email":"olurinjames@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610976050,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Jesus is willing and able to save us from shame - We are created by a God who will turn water into wine before he would allow a bridegroom to ashamed. 

God's intervention requires our cooperation - Although Jesus was willing and able to miraculously save them from shame, they will have missed out on the miracle if they refused to corporate and fill the pot with water at His instruction. 

God's Intervention protects our dignity - Only a few people knew that Jesus had made the wine.  He did it quietly, bringing no attention to Himself allowing the attention to remain on the bride and groom. 

John 2:1-12"}

{"email":"damolaafolabi@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610974975,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:19-34 John 3:23-36
John knew his purpose,had clarity on his role as the fore runner of Jesus.He never took the opportunity of the several questions asked about his personality and Jesus's to give glory to himself or claim what he is not. He spoke of the supremacy of Jesus and declared him the Messiah at every opportunity.

Fully knowing who I am, having clarity of purpose, not allowing confusion to set in by questions and comparisons. Acknowledging Jesus ALWAYS as the supreme one who has instilled in me all my talents/abilities.

John 2
My wine never runs out.Jesus is always around the corner to replenish with better wine.I just need to call on Him."}
column50: {"email":"hannahbheylla@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610974967,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1: 1-5 is mostly about creation. The fact that God used Word to create everything in Genesis chapter 1 (And God said) ,  is a supporting evidence that everything was created through and by the Word who is now revealed as Christ. \nThe Word was with God suggest that God and Jesus are not physically together as we human beings who have the soul and the physical body as one and cannot be separated. E.g. tripartite beings as compared to The Trinity.  Can the two be compared or can one use the tripartite component of human beings to explain Trinity?"}

column52: {"email":"olad.toyin@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610974568,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John the baptist knew exactly who He was. John 3:26 - when his disciples came to him to tell him that Jesus was also baptizing people and had a bigger crowd than he did. John 3:28 - he explained to them what he was called to do - prepare the way for Jesus (John 1:23) - which he did, so there was no need to be in competition with Jesus. He has done his part and was happy and joyful for Jesus to do what HE was sent to do - John 3:29.\n\nIts important to know who you are and what you are called to do. Just because someone else seems to be doing better doesn't discount what God has called you to be/do. How they world is now makes it difficult for us sometimes to be content with what we have been called to do, I feel this is where John 3:30 comes in - Let you flesh give way to God to be the prominent influence in your life"}
column53: {"email":"ad.koya@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610974337,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"The word of the day for me is in John 3:30. John 3:31-36

column59:
{"email":"Christydafe.enebeli@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610973868,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"I am just curious how John and Jesus were as kids until they both came to walk in the fullness of their ministry. John should be a few months older than Jesus but he discerned their relationship accurately 

“cousin Jesus is more than my Cuz, he is actually my maker, my existence, my God”

In my application to my life, I think we should learn to discern people accurately not for just who they are to us by bloodline but by God’s uniqueness, gifted ness and grace on their life.


I am a parent and I handle my children with this knowledge, they are more than being my kids, they are carrying God’s purpose. I pray for grace to discern carefully who they are in God.

“This is the man that I told you about. I told you, “He comes after me, but he is greater than I am. He was already there before I was born.” I did not know him. But I had to show Israel's people who he was. That is why I am baptizing people with water.’”
‭‭John‬ ‭1:30-31‬ ‭EASY‬‬
https://www.bible.com/2079/jhn.1.30-31.easy"}

column61: {"email":"balogunsam11@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610973370,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 3:8 - Being born of the spirit adds dynamism and wonder to our existence. column62: {"email":"uaifohomotese@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610973306,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Being born again means being baptized with water and the Spirit. Water stands for immersion in God's word which means eating it daily and the Spirit guides our understanding and assist through our knowledge of the Word how to handle the issues of life. Thank you Jesus. John 3v5"}
column63:
{"email":"get.pgsl@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610973263,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"That’s when his disciples remembered the Scripture: “I am consumed with a fiery passion to keep your house pure!” But the disciples remembered his prophecy after Jesus rose from the dead, and believed both the Scripture and what Jesus had said.
John 2:17‭, ‬22 TPT

Reflection: 

The disciples knew the scripture but didn't believe it nor take it to heart until after Jesus rose from the dead.
Sometimes we honestly do need a close up personal experience to actually believe.
Then the words become personalized and then without doubt becomes alive in us. 
Strive to encounter God daily!"}
column64: {"email":"steveandjenny82@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610973187,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"How John the Baptist paved the way for Jesus's coming and accepted he will become less and less as the ministry of the Messiah grew. Jesus's wrath at how his father's temple was being used by the Pharisees. To be a true believer in God one must be born again as shown in Jesus's conversation with Nicodemus. Those who believe in God come into the light, those who do not avoid the light for fear their sins will be expose and remain under God's angry judgment."}
column65: {"email":"Sola4christ@ymail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972961,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"This re-emphasis the Sovereignty of God Almighty for me. He knows all things, planned all things and fulfills His plans. He knows every piece of the puzzle. We only have to be completely obedient because he'll match every piece complete to perfection. He knew Jesus Christ, His son needed a forebearer to prepare the minds of people, sow the seeds and water it before. God Almighty is completely Sovereign."}
column66: {"email":"Busolaroberts813@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972888,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"The verse John 1-3 is just so explanatory that tell us very important message that God owns heaven and earth, he created everything in the universe. And not a single thing that lives that GOD doesn’t have a hand in it. He rules and control over everything in the universe. \n\nBusola❤️"}
column67: {"email":"Omokhuapatrick@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972876,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Reflective of the selfless nature of Jesus and the love God as for humanity ."}
column68:
{"email":"Christydafe.enebeli@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972737,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"I noticed here an antidote for handling rejection and building self confidence 

1. Not everyone will like you or what you do though you are anointed 

2. Similarly, not everyone will reject

3. Stay focus on your calling and those God has assigned to believe in you and called you to.

4. Jesus was rejected and he handled it well, it’s no big deal if you experience same. 


5. Focus on who called you and his assignment.


“He came to the place that was his own. But his own people did not accept him. But some people did accept him. They did believe in him. He gave authority to those people to become God's children.”
‭‭John‬ ‭1:11-12‬ ‭EASY‬‬
https://www.bible.com/2079/jhn.1.11-12.easy"}
column69: {"email":"abi.moraks@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972669,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:10-11, 20-21, 31-34, 46-50\nSometimes in expecting blessings to come in a certain way, we miss what God actually has for us. The Jewish leaders expected a Messiah, but were so bound by their image of who he should be that they did not recognize Him. John the Baptist initially did not until he saw the Holy Spirit rest upon Jesus, and neither did Nathaniel until he spent some time with Jesus. Like John and Nathaniel we should be open to God's guidance and spend time with Him when we doubt or are unsure.\nExpect the miraculous to happen, but don't set your mind on how. Let God do his thing."}
column70:
{"email":"Itimieloesther@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972631,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"In John 2, what stood out to me was how people only believed in Jesus more after seeing miracles.
The wedding at Cana-after the miracle  the disciples believed more confidently in Jesus.
In Jerusalem many believed in Jesus only after seeing great signs.
As Christians we shouldn’t believe only after seeing signs but we should lean on the word first and believe because if the word."}
column71: {"email":"Omodaraoladunjoye@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972337,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:16 just tells how generous Jesus is and I must remember to always be thankful"}
column72: {"email":"uyimarcel3@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610972269,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1-12 God acts on what we see as emergency needs. They ran out of wine and needed urgently (maybe the hosts were not even aware), but Mary TOLD JESUS (asking him to do something), not so she might have wine in her own house, but for the host to have. And also Mary was close to Jesus (had a relationship with God ( in flesh)) that even though it was not yet time for Christ to reveal his glory publicly, he did!\nMeaning as Christian's we can stand in the gap for others, to see God manifest himself in their lives, even  without letting them know at first."}
column73: {"email":"Christydafe.enebeli@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610971912,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"I like that God clarified who John was and his mission and who Jesus is in contrast to John.\n\nGod doesn’t leave doubts. He is clear in his intentions"}
column74:
{"email":"tomiwaajayi@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610971818,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"“The wind blows wherever it wants. Just as you can hear the wind but can’t tell where it comes from or where it is going, so you can’t explain how people are born of the Spirit.”
‭‭John‬ ‭3:8‬ ‭NLT‬‬

In this verse, the Bible references the wind. Just as we cannot see the wind but can feel its impact so should our life be so impactful when we are born of the Spirit. People cannot explain but they just feel something within us.

-Tomiwa"}
column75: {"email":"lejlong88@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610971549,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 3:26-28, John the Baptist knew he was just there to prepare the way for the Messiah,which he did with so much joy. Life is not all about competition, let's try and bring out the best in each other gladly without feeling of expectations.:star-str"}
column76: {"email":"Itimieloesther@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610971536,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"In John 1, what stood out to me is how the world did not recognize Jesus - which the world was made through. Infact the Jews didn’t receive him.\nJesus didn’t initially go around talking about himself it was John who pointed Him out.\nFor John 1:12 to take effect, John had to do some work/witnessing. John sowed seeds for the discipleship and followership for Jesus. He triggered something in Andrew that made him the first follower of Jesus."}
column77:
{"email":"efesamuel11@yahoo.ca","unix_timestamp":1610971388,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Good morning family, my mediation on the book of John 1 and 2 

John 1- The Ministry of Jesus

The power of recognition John recognized the spirit on Jesus and this was clear that he was a man with the word of God.

Secondly phillip testimony when speaking to Nathanael about Jesus he spoke concerning the words of the prophets. He knew and believed the word hence believing Jesus was easy.

Summary what the Holy spirit is saying to me is continue studying the word to understand and recognize events.

John 2- 

Miracles are possible even when it's not time as seen in the wedding at Cana.
When we stay with Jesus it brings us to a place of early strange miracles. 

Mediating on the temple of the Lord, Jesus destroyed all selling and buying activities. As hes children we have the power of Attorney to use his name to stop any unpleasant circumstances.

We get results because Jesus is passionate about us. We can trust in him not men."}
column78:
{"email":"coaegbuta@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610971326,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"The book of John starts off with the beginning, while citing Genesis and reaffirming how Christ is the beginning and the Word, and then just steamrolls into Jesus into action. There is no pause. And even with Jesus coming into the limelight, there were that few who did not need who He is to be hammered into them. There was this instant connection - His followership grew. In vs. 29 of John 3, 
> Quoted Text

The bride belongs to the bridegroom. The friend who attends the bridegroom waits and listens for him, and is full of joy when he hears the bridegroom’s voice. That joy is mine, and it is now complete.

This is how our growth in faith should be - should be like a nosedive into the fullness of God. No delay. The long wait for the Messiah had finally manifested, and the lucky few in the beginning, grasped unto it. It covers all we should experience as born-again Christians, from conversion/baptism/acceptance, and knowing how we should be about our Father's business."}
column79: {"email":"fatoyeb@mymts.net","unix_timestamp":1610971301,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Jesus says come, and you will see John 1:39. To see what - miracles and have eternal life. Everyone is going to him John 3:26. He is calling me and you."}
column80: {"email":"bbanjoko123@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610971063,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 3:5 \nOur chance to have the God kind of life is when we enter the kingdom of God at the time we give our lives to Christ. It opens a whole world of possibilities to us, because through Him and in Him, all things are possible."}
column81: {"email":"balogunsam11@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610970466,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:31 - Every assignment God gives is important and purposeful. John’s was to prepare the way for the Lord, and he did it heartily. We must know and accept our assignment and not be distracted by how little or large it seems compared to one given to others."}
column82: {"email":"Lolasal@me.com","unix_timestamp":1610970253,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:12 stood out to me the most that once we become born again our family heritage no longer matters as we immediately become direct descendants of God Himself."}
column83:
{"email":"muyeewa@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610970163,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Who you keep company with or relate with tells how far you will go in life.
John 1:35-39. Andrew and Simon Peter were the first set of disciple that followed Jesus. This was so because they were with John the Baptist already and heard him say ... “Behold the Lamb of God”. 
Watch what you hear and whom you keep friends with. PWA said to grow in faith you need to Hear, Consider and Comprehend. I believe these played a part in the disciples following Jesus.
Peter became a pillar in the gospel.Many ornaments were built to remember him across the world i.e. St Peter Basilica.

Thanks."}
column84: {"email":"eadjo28@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610969297,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"My reflection is on, how easy it took people to believe christ with the little they see or experienced! John 1:50 stood out for me. " I will see greater things than these"......"}
column85: {"email":"chevonegooden82@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610969203,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"All around us is the beauty of God's creation; the world was empty but God filled it with beauty and light! God can always be relied on to make something out of nothing....beauty out of ashes. The basis of God's actions is the WORD, which was first and represents GOD Himself. If I can trust God's word, that means I trust God. Like John....we should never think of ourselves as being too great, we must "decrease so God can increase" in our lives, empty ourselves and trust that God will fill us with His beauty and light!"}
column87: {"email":"pamelaadeyinka11@hotmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610967926,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:12 stood out to me the most, "But to all who believed him and accepted him, he gave the right to become children of GOD". In order to be children of God, we have to do both; believe in him and accept him. we can't do one and abandon the other."}
column88: {"email":"bimpeadebola@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610967765,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:1-5\nThe word(truth, life, essense, principles)of God was an entity in heaven before it was encapsulated inside the physical body generated by Mary and called Jesus by earthly people. The word lived in the physical body in order to show us who God is.\nCalling on the name Jesus alone without the backing of the truth behind the name lacks the power of the name. Understanding and following the truth the name represents makes the name works every time we call on him"}
column90: {"email":"ayomideotieno@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610967352,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"“But as many as received Him, to them He gave the right to become children of God, to those who believe in His name:”\n‭‭John‬ ‭1:12‬ ‭NKJV‬‬"}
column92: {"email":"eaadebiyi@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610966841,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Sincerely,lot of verses stood out to me but I particularly love John 2:1-5.(MARY'S MOTHERLY WISDOM) She propelled Christ (HER SON) to share a memorable moment with her ( HIS FIRST MIRACLE)❤.Even when he initial wasn't ready🤣 in verse 4.She made sure he had no choice🤗,prepared the people for a never-witnessed great event in verse 5, the atmosphere, infact it seem like she already pictured the whole scenario in her mind. Her actions are worthy 👏 of emulation. Adedoyin Adebiyi."}
column93: {"email":"Sonjamclarke@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610966052,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Reading Jonn Chapter 3 reminded me of God’s unconditional love for us. He gave is only begotten Son so that we could have everlasting life.  This is the ultimate sacrifice ! It made me think, what should ever prevent us from giving up worldly things and honouring God."}
column94:
{"email":"eniloloboore@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610965881,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 2:1-12 stood out to me. There was no wine at the wedding anymore and Jesus’ mother came to him to tell him there was no wine. I believe she went to him because she was expecting him to do something about it. She knew he had the power to change the situation and Jesus did change the situation even though it wasn’t time for him to reveal his ministry. 

This reminds me that there’s so much power in my expectations. My expectancy level is a breeding ground for amazing miracles from God. 

When we’re in the presence of God, we should expect God to move, we should expect something extraordinary to happen and we should be ready to receive. 

I can’t imagine how the story would have played out if Jesus’ mother didn’t expect him to do something about the situation."}
column95: {"email":"sophie2278@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610965143,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"ln John 2:15-17, Jesus' actions towards the traders were as a result of His passion for the purity of God's house. As children of God, the zeal to ALWAYS keep our hearts (the temple of God) away from sinful transactions and living a life of holiness should be our goal."}
column97: {"email":"edemsoni@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610964621,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:27: Despite all his accomplishments, John still considered himself unworthy of performing the mundane task of loosening Jesus’s sandals. He was the epitome of humility - certainly worth emulating."}
column98: {"email":"bukola@safarigroupltd.com","unix_timestamp":1610962783,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 2:5 stood out for me when Jesus mother said whatsoever he asked you  do it meaning all our expected miracles depends on our obedience to the instructions been given. Bukola O"}
column99: {"email":"dorisarreybawak@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610961957,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 3: 36 We need to believe  in Jesus Christ and obey Him so that we may have eternal life and be freed from God's angry judgement."}
column100: {"email":"bifash@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610959005,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1 stood out for me, nothing was in existence before God's word breath formation into the earth. His word is light and John is only a touch bearer to introduce God's light -Jesus. Our focus must be on the Light and not the bearer.\nJohn 2:4 also stood out for me. A mother knows best! Mary must have witnessed a lot of miracles performed at home before prompting Jesus when the wine finished at the wedding in Cana of Galilee. As mothers we need to make keen observations of our wards no matter how insignificant their actions may be."}
column101: {"email":"chuma_okafo@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610958569,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":""And he said to him, “Every man at the beginning sets out the good wine, and when the guests have well drunk, then the inferior. You have kept the good wine until now!” John 2:10\n\nIt is in the nature of man to hoard and withhold. To peddle a counterfeit while keeping the best for ourselves and those we favour, only parting with it by charging a very high price or in the expectation of the plaudits of men.  Not so with Christ. The couple did not even know that they were starting at shame but without any fanfare He performed a miracle of provision of such high quality that the expert had to acknowledged it. But this is Jesus on any given day. He is at His best all the time. His gift of salvation is incorruptible, His love for us is eternal, His thoughts towards us are good all the time, He supplies according to His riches in glory and He does exceedingly abundantly above our highest expectations! Everything about Him and His interaction with us is superlative. He is certainly worth believing, pursuing and serving all our days!"}
column102: {"email":"taiyere@yahoo.co.uk","unix_timestamp":1610957190,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 3:1-3 stood out for me as Nicodemus perceived Jesus as ONLY a teacher and NOT a Saviour. The response Jesus gave Nicodemus in verse 3 brought this to light. It goes to show that there may be some unsaved people who are currently in the church."}
column103:
{"email":"dumsy01@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610956658,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:1-4, 17b stood out to me.
 In the beginning was the word, the word was with God and the Word was God. 

The word of God is powerful, it manifested in creation and after. It is for our good to stay anchored in God's word continually, because in it is Light, Life, Grace and Truth. 

John 3:36 Only in Christ Jesus is everlasting life."}
column104: {"email":"mossandra@yahoo.co.uk","unix_timestamp":1610956102,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1: 3 We are reminded once again on our dependency on God. Nothing exist without God. God is the creator. John 1:43-51 at times we tend to focus more of where one is from than who the person is, by focusing on a someone’s  background we might miss our blessing as we see Nathanael first reaction in verse 46, based on his response to Philip, Nathanael focused more on where Jesus was from than who He was. Lastly, we tend to want to see first in order to believe instead we should believe first to see 🙏."}
column105: {"email":"Oluwatoyinaa@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610952761,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:14 And the Word became flesh... I noticed the “Word” here is capital W meaning it is being personalized since it actually became flesh/tangible, it’s God that spoke this Word into becoming flesh and the bible says ye are gods, and so if I’m a god my words become flesh and dwell with me, so I ask myself what words are my speaking?\n\nGod’s word is glorious full of grace and truth, and so my words should not do less! Father help me to guard my utterances let them be full of grace and truth🙏🏽"}
column106:
{"email":"tosin_olad@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610952100,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"Matthew 1:17: The use of number 14  helps to remember the genealogy of Jesus Christ.
14 generations from Abraham to David.
14 generations from David to the captivity in Babylon.
14 generations from the captivity until the Christ.

Secondly, Obedience is my key word today. Joseph heard twice from the angel in Matthew 1:24 & Matthew 2:13-15 and obeyed. The three wise men in Matthew 2:12 were divinely warned and they obeyed. There is an unforseen problem being solved when we obey."}
column107:
{"email":"Karo345@hotmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610950669,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"“Now this is the testimony of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, “Who are you?”

Then they said to him, “Who are you, that we may give an answer to those who sent us? What do you say about yourself?” He said: “I am ‘The voice of one crying in the wilderness: “Make straight the way of the LORD,” ’ as the prophet Isaiah said.””
‭‭John‬ ‭1:19, 22-23‬ ‭NKJV‬‬

“As prophet Isaiah said”

I am reminded that life will cause situations to question my identity in many ways asking me “Who Am I”? 
John got his identity from the word of God and so should I. 

I am first and foremost a Child of God. I thank God for who I am in Him ❤️"}
column108: {"email":"olabisioluwakorede@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610950141,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"What stood out for me:(1) John 1:46 can anything good come out of Nazareth?this affirmed to me that many good things will still come out of me. (2) john 3:27 A man can receive nothing unless it has been given him from heaven. this vs made me to appreciate God even more. (3)john 3:36 he who believes in the Son have everlasting life.. this filled me with peace and hope of eternal life with God."}
column109: {"email":"assumpta_d@hotmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610948807,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"The word was first, before anything else. The word was God, with God and created all. I have to put the word first, before my emotions, before my circumstances and before my own thoughts. To put the word first is to: 1. find His word (cause in it I find Him), 2. prioritize the word and 3. allow His word to be mine so that God in me can bring into being what I desire."}
column110: {"email":"teniolaonabanjo@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610947814,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"In my study today, John 2:13-16 stood out for me, I see my heart as the temple while the trading activities being carried out in the temple were sinful acts. Harmonizing sinful habits with my heart would lead to God’s anger. Jesus said ‘’ Take these things away!” That is exactly how God wants me to take every sinful habit away from my heart."}
column111: {"email":"Takinsiku@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610947738,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1: 4 Not one thing in all creation was made without Jesus. Jesus is at the Center of it all. He is at the Center of our lives. Jesus is the source and sustainer of life that brings light/ revelation to every born again child of God. You can never walk in darkness or Confusion when you have Jesus as The Light!"}
column112:
{"email":"emikeleelamah@yahoo.com","unix_timestamp":1610947333,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:1-5 
God = Word = Life = Light ✨

I’m reminded that my foundation is important. 

Starting with God daily, which is the Word will give me life even when going through difficult times. 

The life in me, which is God’s Light will dispel darkness. The Word illuminates my path and gives me a stronger perspective."}
column113: {"email":"dammyokeowo@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610947331,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:1 In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the word was God! Verse 14: And the Word (God the son) came and dwelt among us. God sent His son in the form of man to dwell amongst us humans to feel what we feel and experience what we go through, to the extent of having to die for our sins. The pain of every stripe and beating was felt! What a sacrifice! Thank you Lord! Praying that the death of your son, our Lord Jesus Christ will not be in vain in our daily lives, in Jesus' name. Amen."}
column114: {"email":"ZINOOBIEGBEDI@GMAIL.COM","unix_timestamp":1610946936,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"John 1:4 reminds me a lot about PWA message yesterday about the boy that Jesus healed at the city gate. Since the bible says in john 1:4 that Word gives life to everything created, it only makes sense that Jesus gave life to the dead boy. In the same way when i speak the Word over dead circumstances, i should expect that situation to come back to life. #Beauty4Ashes"}
column115: {"email":"Zinoobiegbedi@gmail.com","unix_timestamp":1610946552,"date_created":"Fri Jan 22 2021 19:44:26 GMT-0500 (Eastern Standard Time)","comment":"The Word of God is Eternal, the Word of Gives life to everything that was created. John 1:4 NLT. This is such a loaded verse."}
